alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:52PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern De Soto, southern Red River, west central Natchitoches, northern Sabine Parishes in northwestern Louisiana and east central Shelby Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1251 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Coushatta, or 18 miles southeast of Mansfield, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Natchitoches, Campti, Converse, Allen, Oak Grove, Pleasant Hill, Provencal, Natchez, Clarence, Huxley, Noble, Robeline, Powhatan, Stanley, Lake End, Grand Ecore, Belmont, Pelican, Flora and Rambin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
